intro: Ephippiocarpa humilis, commonly known as the dwarf ephippiocarpa, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and melons. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are either male or female. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that ripens to a reddish color, though it is not commonly cultivated for food or ornamental purposes.
